text:
Any slick-but-readable ~one-liners to move some keys from one Dict to another? Something like
```src = Dict(:x => 1, :y => 2, :z => 3)
dst = Dict()

# does this function exist?
move_keys!(dst, src, (:x, :y))

# want to end up with:
src = Dict(:z => 3)
dst = Dict(:x => 1, :y => 2)```
(I would find this useful for manipulating kwargs being passed around to different functions)

elements.text: Any slick-but-readable ~one-liners to move some keys from one Dict to another? Something like

src = Dict(:x => 1, :y => 2, :z => 3)
dst = Dict()

# does this function exist?
move_keys!(dst, src, (:x, :y))

# want to end up with:
src = Dict(:z => 3)
dst = Dict(:x => 1, :y => 2)
(I would find this useful for manipulating kwargs being passed around to different functions)

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>
What would the corresponding values be?

elements.text: What would the corresponding values be?

text: the same ones as in the original dict

elements.text: the same ones as in the original dict

text: I haven't been able to see how to get a "slick-but-readable ~one-liner" with that

elements.text: I haven't been able to see how to get a "slick-but-readable ~one-liner" with that

text:
How is this for a one-liner?
```foreach(k -> dst[k] = pop!(src, k), (:x, :y))```

elements.text: How is this for a one-liner?

text: I think that fits the bill, thanks!

elements.text: I think that fits the bill, thanks!
